channel.title: Tannoyista Audio Reviews
channel.description: Latest hi-fi reviews, speaker tests, and valve amplifier insights

item.title: Acoustic Energy AE509 Loudspeakers
item.description:
The Acoustic Energy AE509 Loudspeakers Review

Acoustic Energy’s AE509 loudspeakers combine affordability with beautiful design and technology. A blend which creates a powerful sound and a natural presence.

  • Type: Two-way floorstanding loudspeakers
  • Drivers: 2 × 125mm carbon fibre mid/bass — 1 × 25mm carbon fibre tweeter
  • Frequency Response: 32Hz — 28kHz (+/± 6dB)
  • Sensitivity: 89dB
  • Impedance: 6 ohms
  • Power Handling: 175W
  • Cabinet: RSC composite with gloss white, black, or walnut finish
  • Dimensions: 1000 — 185 — 280 mm
  • Weight: 22kg each
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Josie Lewis)

item.title: Entreq Protectus & MaxMix T2 Kit
item.description:
Unveiling the Entreq Protectus and MaxMix T2 Kit

Entreq’s Protectus platform and MaxMix T2 dongles offer groundbreaking vibration isolation and magnetic field control for high-end audio systems.

  • Protectus: Isolation platform with embedded metal spheres
  • MaxMix T2: 4 dongles for speaker terminals
  • Effect: Reduces high-frequency noise and electromagnetic interference
  • Materials: Copper, silver, tungsten, magnesium, aluminium
  • Sizes: Available in Level 1–3, Medium to Extra Large
  • Load Capacity: Up to 250kg
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Ultrafide U4PRE Preamplifier Combo
item.description:
The Ultrafide U4PRE Ultra Sigma Preamplifier Review

Paired with the U500DC power amp, the U4PRE delivers studio-grade fidelity with quad outputs, configurable phono stage, and balanced architecture.

  • Type: Quad-output analogue preamplifier
  • Inputs: 2 × RCA, 2 × XLR, 1 × MM/MC phono
  • Outputs: 2 × RCA, 2 × XLR
  • Phono Stage: Adjustable gain and loading
  • Headphone Amp: Class A/B, 8–300 ohm support
  • Display: OLED with remote control
  • Dimensions: Matches U500DC footprint
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Weiss DAC204
item.description:
The Weiss DAC204 Review

Swiss precision meets sonic excellence — the DAC204 offers pristine conversion, versatile inputs, and a compact form factor ideal for audiophiles and professionals alike.

  • Type: High-end digital-to-analogue converter
  • Inputs: USB, AES/EBU, S/PDIF, Toslink
  • Outputs: RCA and XLR analogue
  • Sample Rates: Up to 384kHz PCM, DSD64 via DoP
  • Build: Compact aluminium chassis
  • Sound: Neutral, detailed, and dynamic
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Degritter Mark II Ultrasonic Record Cleaning Machine
item.description:
The Ultimate Vinyl Cleaning Machine : The Degritter Mark II Review

The Degritter Mk-II ultrasonic record cleaning machine is nothing short of essential. With 120kHz pulse-mode cleaning, smart drying, and a sleek aluminium chassis, it’s the most advanced and user-friendly RCM on the market.

  • Cleaning Method: 120kHz ultrasonic with 4 transducers
  • Drying: Smart Dry fan system with adjustable speed
  • Tank: Removable 1.4L water tank
  • Cycle Options: 5:15, 6:45, 8:15, 9:45 minutes
  • Degas Mode: Optional 2:15 cycle for fluid mixing
  • Noise Level: 50–70 dB
  • Dimensions: 37 × 28 × 21 cm
  • Weight: 9kg
  • Power: 300W ultrasonic amplifier
  • Features: Pulse Mode, Frequency Sweep, Active Filtering
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Ranvoice RV1020 Valve Preamplifier
item.description:
The Ranvoice Audio RV-1020 Valve Preamplifier Review

Built in Ukraine with EL84 valves and vintage military-grade components, the RV1020 offers a warm, natural tone and whisper-quiet operation — a true boutique gem.

  • Type: Valve preamplifier with external linear PSU
  • Valves: EL84 ×2, 6N2P ×2
  • Inputs: 2 × RCA line inputs
  • Outputs: 2 × RCA line outputs
  • Power Supply: External box with choke filter
  • Build: Handmade with military-grade Soviet components
  • Chassis: Compact steel with bronze-accented knob
  • Dimensions: 240 × 190 × 65 mm (main unit)
  • Weight: Approx. 4.5kg total
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Croft Vitale SC Preamplifier
item.description:
The Classic CROFT Vitale SC Preamplifier - Upgraded

Upgraded by Firebottle Audio, this Croft Vitale SC preamplifier now features balanced inputs and outputs, a 6SN7 valve buffer stage, and a bespoke EIZZ volume control. A tribute to Glenn Croft’s legacy, it delivers a rich, dynamic sound with vintage charm and modern flexibility.

  • Type: Valve preamplifier with balanced and unbalanced I/O
  • Valves: ECC83 ×1, 5751 ×1, ECC81 ×1, 6SN7 ×3
  • Inputs: Phono, Line 1, Tape, Line 2, Balanced 1 & 2
  • Outputs: RCA and XLR
  • Volume Control: EIZZ 4-section balanced attenuator
  • Upgrades: Gain adjustment, DC heater supply, silver wiring
  • Build: Heavy-duty chassis with Blore Edwards selectors
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Kenwood/Trio L-07D Turntable
item.description:
The Legendary Kenwood/Trio L-07D Turntable - Review

The L-07D doesn’t need any introduction to the turntable ’Hall of Fame’. Alongside the greatest Technics and J.C. Verdier decks, the L-07D stands out on par and just as remarkable. A wonder of engineering and design, it delivers astonishing pace, timing, and bass with a rock-solid image and zero tolerance for speed errors.

  • Type: Quartz PLL direct-drive turntable
  • Platter: Triple-layer composite with aluminium, duralumin, and stainless steel
  • Tonearm: J-shaped, VTA-adjustable, carbon/boron/aluminium composite
  • Motor: Slotless DC servo with dynamic compensation
  • Wow & Flutter: < 0.02% WRMS
  • Signal-to-Noise Ratio: > 94dB
  • Weight: 35kg (main unit), 4.1kg (power/control unit)
  • Features: Anti-skate thread system, second tonearm option, external PSU
  • Dimensions: 555 × 160 × 470 mm
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Khozmo &#8217;Shunt Relay&#8217; Passive Preamplifier
item.description:
Discover the Khozmo ’Shunt Relay’ Passive preamplifier. The purest of audio.

With ZFoil and Takman resistors, relay-based attenuation, and a minimalist design, this passive preamp delivers transparency and detail with studio-grade finesse. It’s beautifully built, whisper-quiet, and designed for systems where sonic purity is paramount.

  • Type: Passive preamplifier with relay attenuation
  • Attenuator: 64-step Shunt with ZFoil & Takman resistors
  • Inputs: 1 × RCA, 2 × XLR
  • Outputs: 1 × RCA, 1 × XLR
  • Display: Dual LED dot-matrix
  • Remote: Aluminium IR remote with mute & standby
  • Chassis: 10mm brushed aluminium with wood cheeks
  • Dimensions: 240 × 210 × 60 mm
  • Weight: 2.8kg
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Entreq Tellus Grounding Box
item.description:
Entreq Tellus Infinity Line Grounding Box - Review

The Tellus Infinity Line grounding box from Entreq reduces unwanted electromagnetic interference, lowers the noise floor, and improves soundstage articulation. Paired with Eartha cables, it adds focus, tonal richness, and separation to any hi-fi system.

  • Type: Grounding device with multiple binding posts
  • Function: Electromagnetic and galvanic isolation
  • Connections: Eartha RCA/XLR/Banana cables
  • Materials: Proprietary mix of minerals and conductors
  • Impact: Lower noise, greater depth, clearer midrange
  • Build: Handcrafted wooden enclosure with internal resonance dampers
  • Compatibility: Amplifiers, sources, speakers
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: The Original Trident Studios Lockwood Loudspeakers
item.description:
The Original Trident Studios Lockwood Loudspeakers - A Piece of Recording History

These original Lockwood loudspeakers from the legendary Trident Studios are iconic. Fitted with Tannoy Monitor Gold drivers and custom crossovers, they played a key role in mixing tracks by Queen, Bowie, Elton John and others. The review documents their provenance, performance, and restoration journey.

  • Drivers: Tannoy Monitor Gold 15"
  • Cabinet: Studio monitor baffle with rear terminal cup
  • Crossover: Custom-built Tannoyista network
  • Sound: Rich midrange, smooth highs, enormous soundstage
  • Provenance: Queen, Bowie, Elton John recording heritage
  • Restoration: New veneer, bracing, and internal damping
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Sepea Audio Studer A80 Stabiliser
item.description:
Sepea Audio Tape Stabiliser for Studer A80

This tape stabiliser from Sepea Audio is a great accessory that enhances the reel and tape performance for the Studer A80 and similar professional machines. It’s a nicely CNC-machined precision weight with a brass centre insert for balance.

  • Material: CNC-machined aluminium with brass insert
  • Weight: Approx. 350g
  • Function: Stabilises tape reels and improves playback accuracy
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Studer A80 Master Tape Machine
item.description:
The Studer A80 Master Tape Reel Machine - Review

The Studer A80/R Master tape recorder has always been regarded as one of the finest transport systems in the world and has been at the heart of countless recordings. Its build quality is second to none and its sound can be truly wonderful.

  • Type: Reel-to-reel master recorder
  • Speeds: 15 ips / 30 ips
  • Features: Butterfly heads, modular cards, precision tape handling
  • Weight: Approx. 96.5kg
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Thorens TD-124 MKII Turntable
item.description:
The Thorens TD-124 MKII Turntable - Review

Built like a battleship and simply timeless. The Thorens TD-124 MKII has a tone and sound that delivers reality and presence. This turntable is compact, well laid out and quite practical by design. But its sound is what makes it so special.

  • Type: Belt/idler hybrid turntable
  • Speed: 16⅔ / 33⅓ / 45 / 78 RPM
  • Motor: E50 or Pabst 10W
  • Features: ±3% pitch control, removable sub-chassis
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Air Tight ATM-1 Valve Power Amplifier
item.description:
The Air Tight ATM-1 Valve Power Amplifier - Review

This is the ATM-1 Valve Power Amplifier from Japanese brand Air Tight. With 36W per channel, it delivers a finely-tuned balance of weight, presence and articulation. A valve amplifier that is detailed, punchy and sweet with refined tone.

  • Power: 36W + 36W (8Ω)
  • Valves: 6CA7 ×4, 12AU7 ×2, 12AX7 ×1, 5AR4 ×2
  • Frequency Response: 20Hz–20kHz ±1dB
  • THD: 0.1% @ 1W, 1.0% @ full output
  • Dimensions: 368 × 298 × 231 mm
  • Weight: 22kg
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Mark Grant Cables HDX1
item.description:
The Mark Grant Cables HDX1 interconnects - Review 2021

Discover the HDX-1 RCA Interconnect cables by Mark Grant. Back in 2010, I discovered that after ploughing through so many interconnect cables. The art of getting something sounding right together with robust reliability and cost differed considerably.

  • Type: RCA interconnect cables
  • Core: Solid pure copper
  • Shielding: Dual-layer copper screening
  • Jacket: Semi-translucent, flexible
  • Plugs: Rounded RCA with optional WBT upgrade
  • Burn-in Time: Approx. 48–72 hours
  • Sound Signature: Neutral, balanced, dynamic
item.author: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Pioneer PD-91 CD Player
item.description:
The Pioneer PD-91 Compact Disc Player - Review 2012

Discover the classic Pioneer PD-91 Compact Disc Player. Is it worth it? The Pioneer PD-91 is considered a rare piece of equipment to own but in 2020, is it worthwhile owning such a classic piece of kit.

  • DAC: Dual Burr Brown PCM-65
  • Frequency Response: 2Hz–20kHz
  • Signal to Noise Ratio: 114dB
  • THD: 0.0015%
  • Output: 2V line, coaxial & optical digital
  • Weight: 11.7kg
  • Year: 1991
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: ALLO Revolution DAC + USBridge
item.description:
The ALLO Revolution DAC + USBridge - Review 2020

Discover the ALLO Revolution DAC with the USBridge. I first started reviewing music streamers back in 2015 with the IQaudio DAC. Subsequently, the ALLO BOSS + Piano with the BOBW PSU and then the KATANA + Isolator + Shanti. You can read my review on the Katana. And my review of the Shanti PSU.

  • DAC: Revolution DAC (ESS chipset)
  • Transport: USBridge Signature
  • Display: LED with remote control
  • Sound: Neutral, wide, airy, non-fatiguing
  • DSD Support: DSD512, DoP256
  • Power Supply: Recommended with Shanti PSU
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: SPL Volume2 Monitor Control
item.description:
The SPL Volume2 Monitor Control - Review 2020

Discover the SPL Volume 2 Monitor Control for Studio and home use. The SPL Volume2 came to me on a recommendation of a friend who runs her own studio in Dorset, UK. Although she also used other monitor controls on occasion, this monitor was always the one she used for reference.

  • Type: Active balanced monitor controller
  • Inputs/Outputs: 2 × XLR in, 2 × XLR out
  • Control: ALPS potentiometer, mute switch
  • Build: Aluminium chassis, Neutrik connectors
  • Sound: Accurate, clean, full-bodied
  • Mods: Op-amp upgrades, stepped attenuator possible
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Funk Firm Houdini & Achromat
item.description:
The Funk Firm Houdini & Achromat - Review 2020

Discover the Funk Firm Houdini and Achromat for your turntable. If you’re serious about vinyl then this has to be one of the most important additions to your deck you will ever make. It doesn’t matter if you own a £50,000 deck or a sub £1000 deck. The Funk Houdini and the Funk Achromat have to be on your purchase list.

  • Houdini: Cartridge decoupler with torsion-tether suspension
  • Achromat: Energy-dissipating platter mat
  • Compatibility: Works with most tonearms and cartridges
  • Sound: Improved tracking, wider soundstage, better bass
  • Installation: Includes jig, nylon screws, instructions
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: RECTEC M142 Recording Monitor
item.description:
The RECTEC M-142 Recording Monitor - Review 2019

Discover the beautifully made RECTEC M-142 Recording monitor. I admit, trying to find a decent monitor preamp that filled my criteria to be on the input source of one of the best Reel to Reel machines was a task. There are plenty out there but most don’t have everything you need.

  • Type: Recording monitor for reel-to-reel decks
  • Inputs: LINE IN, TO RECORD, FROM RECORD, TO MONITOR
  • Controls: Source selector, repro/input pots, headphone level
  • Metering: VU meters with peak indicators
  • Build: 2U chassis, Italian design, Neutrik XLR sockets
  • Sound: Transparent, accurate, improves with burn-in
  • Extras: TRS headphone socket, 12V DC light output
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: ALLO Shanti Power Supply
item.description:
The ALLO Shanti Power Supply for Digital Audio - Review

Discover the ALLO Shanti Ultra Low Noise Linear Power Supply. With the announcement of a suited Power supply for the KATANA, the whole Allo Dac package is now totally fulfilled. I had been waiting for this for quite some time. It’s now time to see what this thing can really do.

  • Outputs: Dual 5.2V (3A and 1.2A)
  • Noise Level: 0.08uV in audio band
  • Filtering: LDO, supercapacitors, 15,000uF capacitance
  • Compatibility: Katana, Digione Sig, Revolution DAC, RPI4
  • Sound: Smooth, analogue-like, focused bass
  • Build: Compact, silent operation, red LED glow
  • Extras: Long output cables, plug adapters included
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Volumio Primo Music Streamer
item.description:
The VOLUMIO Primo Music Streamer - Review 2019

Discover the compact Volumio Primo Music Streamer. The Primo is the new music streamer from Volumio. From out of the box it looks very discreet. No functioning lights, not even on the front of the unit. No buttons either so as you can see, it’s very minimalistic.

  • DAC: ESS90x8Q2M chipset
  • Outputs: RCA, digital coaxial
  • Connectivity: USB, HDMI, Ethernet, Wi-Fi
  • Interface: Volumio OS, web-based setup
  • Sound: Smooth, focused bass, wide soundstage
  • Resampling: Up to 768kHz, DSD playback supported
  • Build: Matte black finish, compact and silent
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: ALLO Katana DAC and Isolator
item.description:
The ALLO Katana 1.2 DAC with Isolator - Review 2018

Discover the fabulous ALLO Katana 1.2 DAC with Isolator. I’ve been using the Allo DAC products from the start and although there were some very understandable development hiccups on the way. But now Allo has flourished as a company and offers a plethora of high-quality audiophile products and the Katana is one which really stands out from the crowd.

  • DAC: Katana 1.2
  • Isolator: Latest version included
  • Platform: RPI 3
  • Power Supply: Compatible with Shanti PSU
  • Sound: Smooth, analogue-like, wide soundstage
  • Setup: Easy assembly with modular boards
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Rotel RCH10 Passive Preamplifier
item.description:
The ROTEL RHC-10 MICHI passive preamplifier

Discover the 90s classic Rotel RHC-10 Michi Passive Preamplifier. The Rotel RHC-10 passive is something that passed me by back in the 90s. So, when this came into Tannoyista towers, it was quite surprising. At the time of this review, my Croft Epoch Elite was on its way to being upgraded by Glenn. On the return of the Croft I performed an extensive A/B test and I have to say, the Rotel was impressive.

  • Type: Passive preamplifier
  • Design: Dual mono with Ko-On pots
  • Inputs: Multiple RCA line inputs
  • Outputs: RCA line outputs
  • Build: 90s overengineered chassis
  • Sound: Organic, delicate, clean bass
  • Weight: Approx. 5kg
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Tannoyista Crossovers Monitor Gold
item.description:
The Tannoyista Tannoy Monitor Gold Crossover Development

Discover more about the development of the Tannoyista Crossover for the Tannoy Monitor Gold Loudspeakers. This is the research and development history of the Tannoyista Tannoy Monitor Gold external crossovers by Tannoyista.

  • Versions: V1 to V4 with progressive upgrades
  • Components: Mundorf, Duelund, Jensen, ClarityCap
  • Design: External, mirrored layout, solid oak case
  • Compatibility: Tannoy Monitor Gold 12" & 15"
  • Sound: Improved spatial separation, transient speed
  • Production: Over 10 units worldwide
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: ALLO Boss DAC Music Steamer RPI Sparky Kali Volt
item.description:
ALLO Boss Audio DAC Piano, RPI, Sparky, Kali, Volt - Review

Discover more about the ALLO Boss DAC with Piano 2.1, RPI, Sparky, Kali and Volt Amplifier. In 2016 I was using the IQAudio DAC+ for quite some time and found it to be really quite astonishing for such a small unit. It was the first DAC I used in conjunction with the Raspberry Pi. But then along came ALLO.

  • DAC: Piano 2.1 with PCM5142 chips
  • Streamer: RPI and Sparky SBC
  • Re-clocker: Kali board
  • Amplifier: Volt class D amp
  • Power Supply: Capacitance Multiplier
  • Output: 4 × RCA (stereo + subwoofer)
  • Software: MAX2PLAY with Squeezelite
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Tube Distinctions Copper Amplifier
item.description:
The Tube Distinctions KT-150 Copper Valve Amplifier - Review

Discover more about the fabulous Tube Distinctions KT-150 Copper Power Amplifier. The Tube Distinctions Copper Amp is my current amplifier. Falling neatly in between my Croft Epoch Elite preamplifier and my 15" Tannoy Monitor Gold Lockwood Major loudspeakers, the Copper makes its presence felt.

  • Type: KT-150 valve power amplifier
  • Output: 50W per channel, pure Class A
  • Valves: KT-150, 6SN7, 5U4GB
  • Chassis: Pure copper, handmade in Wales
  • Transformers: Sowter UK (4 total)
  • Features: HT sleep switch, feedback adjustment
  • Weight: Approx. 40kg
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Croft Epoch Elite Valve Preamplifier
item.description:
The Upgraded Croft Epoch Elite Pre-amplifier - Review 2016

Discover the Croft Epoch Elite Pre-amplifier - Upgraded by the late Glenn Croft. The Epoch Elite was a cousin of the Croft Charisma preamplifier made by Croft in the 1990s. Glenn Croft was still involved with Eminent Audio (its marketing arm) at this stage to which that relationship eventually turned sour.

  • Type: Valve preamplifier with MM phono stage
  • Valves: 6SN7, 6SL7
  • Upgrades: ClarityCap MR, Mundorf caps, Khozmo attenuator
  • Power Supply: External dual 500VA transformers
  • Sound: Deep soundstage, organic, dynamic
  • Build: Custom faceplate, acrylic spacers
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Tannoyista Tannoy Monitor Gold Loudspeaker Crossovers
item.description:
The Tannoyista Tannoy Monitor Gold Crossovers - Review 2016

Discover the ultimate crossovers for the Tannoy Monitor Gold Loudspeakers - By Tannoyista. Designed and handmade in Great Britain, the Tannoyista crossovers give these classic Tannoy Monitor Gold loudspeakers a refreshed sound without losing their magic, uniqueness and dynamics.

  • Design: Handmade in Great Britain
  • Compatibility: Tannoy Monitor Gold 15” & 12” drivers
  • Casework: Solid oak dovetailed housing
  • Wiring: Point-to-point layout
  • Sound: Natural, dynamic, spatially refined
  • Production: Over 30 units worldwide
  • Upgrades: ClarityCap, Duelund, Jensen, Mundorf components
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: CTS Lockwood Universal Loudspeakers
item.description:
CTS Studios Lockwood Universal Loudspeakers - Review 2012

Discover the Ex CTS Studios Lockwood Universal Loudspeakers. The Tannoys are funny old things. They have a character in a very British way. With a quite focused hot spot on the treble you have a more recessed listening zone in comparison to other general kinds of speaker designs but when you’re in there, man… there is no getting out.

  • Cabinet Type: Lockwood Universal
  • Volume: Approx. 200 litres
  • Drivers: Tannoy Monitor Gold 12”
  • Origin: CTS Studios, later Toe Rag Studios
  • Sound: Vast, accurate, non-tubby
  • Finish: Originally grey/blue studio paint
  • Extras: Ceiling hangers, studio provenance
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Pioneer RT-909 Black Reel to Reel
item.description:
The Pioneer RT-909 Black Edition Reel to Reel

Discover the awesome black version update of the RT-909 Reel-to-Reel tape machine. The original black version of the RT-909 was made in small numbers for the U.S military. This version is named the ’Swiss version’ by Vlad Frincu, ‘the best’ update for the RT-909.

  • Type: Reel-to-reel tape deck
  • Finish: Custom black anodised panels
  • Upgrades: Remote control, damper, re-lapped heads
  • Sound: Warm, detailed, vintage signature
  • Production: Limited Swiss edition
  • Extras: Rebuilt tension arms, laser-aligned head block
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Croft Quad2 Amplifiers
item.description:
The Croft Acoustics QUAD II KT88 Amplifiers - Review 2011

Discover the classic QUAD 2 Power Monoblock Amplifiers upgraded by the late Glenn Croft. The Croft modified QUAD II monoblock amplifiers in conjunction with my Tannoy Monitor Gold loudspeakers. A classic combination.

  • Type: KT88 valve monoblock amplifiers
  • Conversion: KT66 to KT88 by Glenn Croft
  • Valves: Gold Lion KT88, Brimar, Mullard
  • Sound: Blooming, dynamic, authoritative
  • Build: Vintage QUAD II chassis, resprayed grey/blue
  • Synergy: Ideal with Tannoy Monitor Gold loudspeakers
  • Upgrades: GEC KT88s, Mark Grant cables
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Chord CPM2600, SPM600 & SPM1032 Amplifiers
item.description:
CHORD CPM 2600, SPM 600 & SPA 1032 Amplifiers - Review 2009

Discover the Awesome Chord CPM-2600, SPM-600 & SPA-1032 Power Amplifiers. In 2009 my amplification setup consisted of a Chord CPM2600 Integrated amplifier bi-amped with firstly an SPM600, and then the Chord SPA1032.

  • CPM2600: Integrated amp with balanced inputs
  • SPM600: Power amp with deeper soundstage
  • SPA1032: Studio-grade amp with cooling fans
  • Build: Thick aluminium, 20kg weight
  • Sound: Detailed, dynamic, studio-grade resolution
  • Synergy: Best with DALI and Harbeth speakers
  • Upgrades: Balanced connections, fan bypass
item.dc:creator: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)

item.title: Michell Gyro SE Turntable
item.description:
The Michell Gyro SE Turntable - Review 2010

Discover the classic Michell Gyro SE Turntable - An iconic turntable. Back in 2010 my turntable was the Michell Gyro SE. It was to be one of my statement turntables before I migrated to the Thorens TD124 MKII.

  • Suspension: Three-point spring system
  • Bearing: Inverted oil platter bearing
  • Motor: Freestanding unit
  • Platter: Brass weights for stability
  • Setup: Complex, best on wall plinth
  • Sound: Precise, fluid, lacks soul vs TD124
  • Mods: Delrin bearing, dampened subframe
item.author: contact.tannoyista@gmail.com (Jo Lewis)
